bibl.title: State of Washington v. John W. Considine. Substitution of Attorneys
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OFT THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JOHN W. CONSIDINE FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
div1.p: I, JOHN W. CONSIDINE, do hereby employ, constitute and substitute HARRISON BOSTWICK as my Attorney in the foregoing entitled proceedings, in lieu and in stead of Messrs. Wiley and Bostwick, formerly my Attorneys and the Attorneys of record in said cause.

And I do, hereby instruct and authorize my said Attorney, Harrison Bostwick, to take such proceedings and to do all and every act which he may deem proper and necessary to protect my interest in said proceedings.
div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JOHN W. CONSIDINE FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED Aug 19 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT. A. Reeves Ayres, CLERK.
